comments.body: FYI @kjlubick This appears to be the request that was timing out.
Alright, that also is prone to the 5 QPS limit atm.  I'll dig in a bit and see what we can do about it before our discussion tomorrow.
Actually, that one is on a rate limit that is way under 5QPS, but measurements show that it might not need to be.
https://bugs.chromium.org/p/skia/issues/detail?id=9557 for tracking Gold side changes
Why throw instead of just returning that the ignore is not active?

This way provides insight into why it fails in this case (ignore has expired). It could fail based purely on the fact that there is not an ignore in place. i.e. My PR is making a golden change I did not expect!
Can you maybe log the arguments if the exit code is non zero?
As extra debugging (for the flaky failures), it would be nice to know what the contents of the result-state.json file in that working directory are.

comments.body: Is workDirectory in source control?  Should we be putting this in some kind of temp directory that gets blown away after CI is done?
If I'm reading this right, it's coming from https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/44474/files#diff-259a52e89a62c0e0633f88f4307c22b7L142, which is not tracked by source control - is that right?

> Is workDirectory in source control? 

I am not sure what you mean by this.

I thought it was automatically blown away on ci since we start with a clean instance for each build. I can split it out further for ci/non-ci code paths, but I thought this would keep it from becoming a more complicated code path for those cases.
Yeah this should be fine.  I was worried we were modifying something that the Flutter source control cared about with this.
Should this actually throw to indicate that there was an error instead of silently swallowing it? Here and below.
We don't throw on master to prevent the tree from going red when someone is landing a change.
@blasten, on master in post-submit, this currently returns true regardless of the result. For driver tests, did you want this to fail since we do not run pre-submit tests?
Can we just avoid writing this file to a location that gets cached between CI runs?

I would like to do that, I filed #50148 to keep up with it and hopefully just incorporate it into the refactoring I'm doing for #49837 and #49749. I think I am going to have to change where all of the files are being managed, json/images/etc, not just this file, which will take a bit more doing. I wanted to unblock others in the meantime.
Can we add a TODO with a link to those bugs/PRs then?

Unless, do you think just using the CIRRUS_WORKING_DIR as the skia client's work directory would do it? I don't know yet where Cirrus draws the line on caching. I thought it wasn't caching these originally. ðŸ˜…

On macs we don't do any caching.  You can find out which directories are caching by looking for task names postfixed with _cache.

...although now that I look at it, it seems like the directory this is in doesn't get cached.  Which directory is it again?

That's what I thought.. here's one:
```
Authentication set up in directory
/tmp/flutter sdk/bin/cache/pkg/skia_goldens1880/packages/flutter/test/widgets/temp
```

ah..
from .cirrus.yml for linux shards:
```
flutter_pkg_cache:
    folder: bin/cache/pkg
    fingerprint_script: echo $OS; cat bin/internal/*.version
```
I might be able to get away with just using `Directory.systemTemp` for when we are on Cirrus. That should clean up after itself. I don't want to hide golden files when folks are using them elsewhere.
Yeah, we're caching the pkg directory for sure.
The goldens repo used to invalidate the cache since it had a version file.
I'm inclined to leave this here as a back up, we can make sure we aren't caching anything, but if for some reason Gold tries to fallback on gsutil again it should catch it.
SG
I decided to make this required since we don't handle null in the switch below.
yay definite assignment analysis
